q: In Oracle, the temporary tablespaces should be locally managed and uniform size should be a multiple of the ________________________.

If you have created a big tablespace with a size of 15G using the following statement:

SQL> CREATE BIGFILE TABLESPACE test DATAFILE ‘/u01/ORADATA/test01.dbf’ size 15G;

Which of the following commands will you use to increase the size of this tablespace?

a.option: alter tablespace test ADD DATAFILE ‘/u01/ORADATA/test02.dbf’ size 15G
alter tablespace test MODIFY DATAFILE ‘/u01/ORADATA/test01.dbf’ AUTOEXTEND ON

q: In Oracle, where is the free space primarily managed for a tablespace created with an automatic segment-space management?

In Oracle Database 11g, you are executing the following command with the default tablespace type property: 

SQL>CREATE TABLESPACE HR DATAFILE ‘/u01/ORADATA/HR01.dbf’ SIZE 1G;
Which of the following statements about the HR Tablespace is correct?
In Oracle, sometimes, no alerts are generated if the actual space usage has reached the specified warning threshold value because ___________________.

a.option: The EVEN parameter was not set
The SQL_TRACE parameter is set to FALSE
The TIMED_STATISTICS parameter is set to FALSE
The STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is set to BASIC

q: Your database contains a locally managed uniform sized table space with automatic segment space management, which contains only tables. Currently, the uniform size for the table space is 512 K. Because the tables have become so large, your configuration must change to improve performance. Now the tables must reside in a table space that is locally managed, with uniform size of 5 MB and automatic segment-space management. What must you do to meet the new requirements?

a.option: The new requirements cannot be met
Re-create the control file with the correct settings
Create a new table space with correct settings then move the tables into the new table space
